wikipedia_page.main: Charles Leonard Davis (14 February 1884 – 27 January 1959) was an Australian politician. He was the Labor member for Port Pirie in the South Australian House of Assembly from 1947 to 1959.He had previously been the mayor of the City of Port Pirie from 1949 to 1957.

response: Charles Davis or Charlie Davis may refer to:

* Charles Davis (flute player) (born 1946), American jazz flautist
* Charles Davis (actor) (1925–2009), Irish character actor
* Charles Davis (land purchase agent) ( – 1887), New Zealand interpreter, writer and land purchase agent

* Charles Davis (basketball, born 1984), naturalized Azerbaijani basketball player

* Charles Davis (theologian) (1923–1999), British Jesuit theologian, famous for publicly leaving the Catholic Church in 1966
* Charles Davis Limited, company formed in 1847 in Tasmania

In 1943, he was elected to the Australian House of Representatives as the Labor member for Grey, defeating sitting United Australia Party member Oliver Badman. A long-term delegate to party conferences, he had defeated Australian Workers' Union nominee Charles Davis for Labor preselection. Though described himself as a moderate, he won with the support of more militant unions. Russell held the seat until his death in 1963.

: The Labor member for Port Pirie, Charles Davis, died on 27 January 1959. No by-election was held due to the imminent 1959 state election.
